channel.title: MORPG - Part 1 [Creating the single player concept]
channel.description:
Well as a few or some of you may know, I started and had a bit of progress making a multiplayer online RPG, but the task was just too large for me and my partner to do without losing interest with the lack of progress. So I've decided to take what I have, and make it simpler by first creating a single player version.
I will [b]not[/b] be using slick, I just can't shake the feeling that it's not my work when I use it. Apologies to anyone that was hoping for a slick tutorial.
I'll be transferring everything to my new computer soon, where I'll give you guys a progress update with everything I have so far.
[u][b]Progress:[/b][/u]
[ul][li]Simple map loading and drawing with the update/graphics loops[/li] [li]Simple pathfinding using tile properties for blocked tiles[/li] [li]Simple animation support[/li][/ul]
Next on the list: Entity support with walking

item.title: MORPG - Part 1 [Creating the single player concept]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Nope, I’m working on something else at the moment

Then I have my chess game to finish (that I actually made good progress on, I really only need to add the piece logic then it’s playable)

THEN I may reopen this

Read full topic

@davidi2 wrote:

Well as a few or some of you may know, I started and had a bit of progress making a multiplayer online RPG, but the task was just too large for me and my partner to do without losing interest with the lack of progress. So I’ve decided to take what I have, and make it simpler by first creating a single player version.

I will not be using slick, I just can’t shake the feeling that it’s not my work when I use it. Apologies to anyone that was hoping for a slick tutorial.

I’ll be transferring everything to my new computer soon, where I’ll give you guys a progress update with everything I have so far.
